fullText: Fun summer movies are being turned into dreary summer theater this August. The tone-deaf “Back to the Future” musical is now followed by “The Shark Is Broken,” written by Ian Shaw and Joseph Nixon, which tells the behind-the-scenes story of the making of “Jaws.”

keyPhrases.quote: Fun summer movies are being turned into dreary summer theater

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: The critic uses strongly negative language ('dreary', 'tone-deaf') to describe both this show and the broader trend of movie-to-theater adaptations, but this appears to be only an excerpt from a longer review. | GPT-4o-mini: The review expresses strong disapproval of the production, indicating it fails to capture the fun of the original movies. | Note: Models differed by 18 points.
